item.title: by: Chopped
item.description: Yeah, but if you really want to look at "high" REST", you'll first have to remove the bongwater from under your eyelids. This will help you perpetuate a much more clear image of REST and once you have done that, "high" has already be determined. Beyond this, I see no reason to split ATOMs.

item.title: by: Phil Wilson
item.description:
Unless you're suggesting everyone implement their own versions of the APP based on an incomplete spec (over a number of years so the implementations would not be interoperable), I'm not sure what the example of your mobile Atom client proves.

In fact, if you were being picky, you could say that no-one has implemented the Atom API at all.
